analyzed: mkhyen dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “with knowledge and love” means

analyzed: rgyang bsrings pa'i phyir 'phags pa'o //
translated: or because they have been sent far away.

translated: those who have laid down the burden,🔽those who have accomplished their own goal,🔽and those who have attained complete freedom.

analyzed: skyes bu zung bzhi dang gang zag ya brgyad kyi tshogs te / de dag 'dus pa la bya'o //

analyzed: yang na da ltar gyi dge 'dun bzhi yan chad do //
translated: Or else, the present-day assembly is four or more [monks].

analyzed: de la zag pa ni 'dod pa dang ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa'o //

analyzed: khur bor ba ni phung po lnga'i khur bor ba'o //
translated: The one who has laid down the burden is the one who has laid down the burden of the five aggregates.

analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni las gcig dang nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'am bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The arhat is the one who has destroyed the enemy of karma and the afflictions, or the one who has destroyed the enemy of grasping at self.

original: phyag 'tshal te zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis phyag bya ba'o //
translated: Having paid homage means to pay homage to the Three Jewels with body, speech, and mind.

original: de la lus kyis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la lus kyis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, paying homage with the body is

translated: bowing with the five limbs.

original: ngag gis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngag gis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: Paying homage with speech is

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan brjod cing bstod pa byed pa'o //
translated: reciting and praising the qualities of the Three Jewels.

original: yid kyis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid kyis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: Paying homage with the mind is

original: sangs rgyas dag mngon par bzhugs par rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag mngon par bzhugs par rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
translated: one-pointedly visualizing the Buddhas as actually present.

original: de la yang nad pa tshabs po che'i ni yan lag dang ldan pas bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang nad pa tshabs po che'i ni yan lag dang ldan pas bya'o //
translated: The sick person should do it with two limbs.

original: nad pa ni yan lag gnyis dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nad pa ni yan lag gnyis dang ldan pas so //
translated: The sick person should do it with two limbs.

original: mi na bas ni yan lag gsum kas so //
analyzed: mi na bas ni yan lag gsum kas so //
translated: The healthy person should do it with all three limbs.

original: dge ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba ste /
translated: Virtue is threefold: virtue of body, virtue of speech, and virtue of mind.

original: de la lus kyi sgo nas dge ba ni /
analyzed: de la lus kyi sgo nas dge ba ni /
translated: Virtue of body is

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba'o //
translated: abandoning killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi dge ba ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / thun tshags su smra ba dang / tshig rtsub mo dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi dge ba ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / thun tshags su smra ba dang / tshig rtsub mo dag spangs pa'o //
translated: Virtue of speech is abandoning lying, slander, harsh speech, and gossip.

original: yid kyi dge ba ni log par lta ba dang / ngan du sems pa dang / chags sems spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dge ba ni log par lta ba dang / ngan du sems pa dang / chags sems spangs pa'o //
translated: Virtue of mind is abandoning wrong views, malice, and covetousness.

original: yang na lus kyi dge ba spyod lam bzhi mdzes pa dang / ngag gi dge bcal col du mi smra zhing dus su smra ba dang / yid kyi dge ba dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran zhing tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi dge ba spyod lam bzhi mdzes pa dang / ngag gi dge bcal col du mi smra zhing dus su smra ba dang / yid kyi dge ba dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran zhing tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Or else, the virtue of the body is the four beautiful deportments; the virtue of speech is not speaking nonsense and speaking at the right time; the virtue of mind is remembering the Three Jewels and possessing the four immeasurables.

original: tshul gyi zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshul gyi zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi'o //
translated: The rules are the four rules of the ascetic.

original: cho ga rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cho ga rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rituals are

original: tshul khrims bcu dang / dge tshul rnams kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bcu dang / dge tshul rnams kyi cho ga'o //
translated: the ten precepts and the rituals for novices.

original: mdo tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'bum pa'i nang nas dge slong khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu 'byung ba las dge tshul mi srung ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum du zad mod kyi /
analyzed: mdo tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'bum pa'i nang nas dge slong khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu 'byung ba las dge tshul mi srung ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum du zad mod kyi /
translated: The brief means that from within the one hundred thousand Vinaya, the two hundred and fifty precepts for monks are complete, but the precepts for novices are not complete.

original: thams cad ni lhag tu ma mchis te rtsa ba nyi tshe btus pas na mdo tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni lhag tu ma mchis te rtsa ba nyi tshe btus pas na mdo tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: However, since all the roots are collected, it is called brief.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The definite means

original: mkhan pos rang bzo byas pa ni ma yin gsungs rab kyi lung @29b 'dul ba'i nang nas btus pas na nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan pos rang bzo byas pa ni ma yin gsungs rab kyi lung @29b 'dul ba'i nang nas btus pas na nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Master says that this is not his own invention, but is called “certainty” because it is extracted from the Vinaya scriptures.

original: bshad par bya zhes pa ni bstan pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa zhes pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes pa ni bstan pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa zhes pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: “ I will explain” means “I will teach” and “I will expound,” and “I will say” is a synonym.

original: yang na de ltar phyag btsal ba dang / dam bcas pa dang gdams ngag lta bur ston to //
analyzed: yang na de ltar phyag btsal ba dang / dam bcas pa dang gdams ngag lta bur ston to //
translated: Or else, it shows that the homage is like a promise, and the promise is like advice.

original: sh'akya zhes pa ni de yang ston pa rnams kyis dam bcas pas sngon te /
analyzed: sh'akya zhes pa ni de yang ston pa rnams kyis dam bcas pas sngon te /
translated: “ Śākya” is the clan of the Teacher, and it is mentioned first.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: khyim pa'i rigs yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i rigs ye shes yongs su dag par bstan to //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rigs yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i rigs ye shes yongs su dag par bstan to //
translated: It shows the purity of the family of the layperson and the purity of the family of the renunciant through wisdom.

original: de la sh'akya zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi yod pas rgyal rigs kyi nang na yang sh'akya'i rigs gtsang zhing kha drag pa'i nang du bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir dga' ldan gnas nas rigs der skyes pa na rigs la mtshan du gsol to //
analyzed: de la sh'akya zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi yod pas rgyal rigs kyi nang na yang sh'akya'i rigs gtsang zhing kha drag pa'i nang du bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir dga' ldan gnas nas rigs der skyes pa na rigs la mtshan du gsol to //
translated: The name Shakya is applied to the four castes, but the Shakya caste is the most pure and noble of the royal castes. The Lord was born into that caste in the Tusita heaven in order to subdue it. He was given the name Shakya because of his caste.

original: sh'akya'i bstan pa la bdag nyid dad pas rab tu byung bas lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung bar bstan to //🔽seng ge zhes pa ni byol song gi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can ji ltar ri dags thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang mu stegs can dang phyir rgol ba thams cad sba bkong zhing zil gyis gnon par mdzad de //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bstan pa la bdag nyid dad pas rab tu byung bas lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung bar bstan to // seng ge zhes pa ni byol song gi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can ji ltar ri dags thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang mu stegs can dang phyir rgol ba thams cad sba bkong zhing zil gyis gnon par mdzad de //
translated: Since he went forth from his caste out of faith in the teachings of the Shakya, he protected his training as if it were his own body. This shows the purity of his going forth.

original: seng ge dang 'dra ba'i phyir dpe de las mtshan du gsol to //
analyzed: seng ge dang 'dra ba'i phyir dpe de las mtshan du gsol to //
translated: The name Lion was given to him because of this simile: Just as the lion, king of beasts, overpowers all other animals, so the Buddha overpowers and subdues all the tirthikas and opponents.

original: 'dis ni rab tu byung ba'i yongs su dag par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rab tu byung ba'i yongs su dag par ston to //
translated: This shows the purity of his going forth.

original: bstan pa la zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod gsum ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod gsum ste /
translated: The word “teaching” refers to the three scriptural collections of the śrāvakas.

original: theg pa chen po'i gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis la bya'o //
translated: “The scriptures of the Great Vehicle” refers to the twelve divisions of the scriptures of the Great Vehicle.

original: dad pas zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang ldan pa bzhi dang / las dang 'bras bu la yid ches shing mngon par dad pas sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: dad pas zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang ldan pa bzhi dang / las dang 'bras bu la yid ches shing mngon par dad pas sems dang ba'o //
translated: “Faith” means to have a clear mind that is full of confidence and faith in the Three Jewels and in the law of karma and its effects.

original: rab tu byung bas zhes pas rab tu byung ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung bas zhes pas rab tu byung ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Having gone forth” means to have gone forth in one of the four ways.

original: phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis phongs te rab tu byung ba ni ma smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis phongs te rab tu byung ba ni ma smos te /
translated: “Having gone forth through the conditions of poverty” is not mentioned here.

original: 'dir ni khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs te /
translated: Here, one has abandoned the marks of a layperson

original: dge tshul gyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: and possesses the marks of a novice monk.

original: rkyen gyis rab tu byung ba ni ma yin no //🔽brtul zhugs zhes pa ni mu stegs kyi brtul zhugs zhes bya ba yod mod kyi ;
analyzed: rkyen gyis rab tu byung ba ni ma yin no // brtul zhugs zhes pa ni mu stegs kyi brtul zhugs zhes bya ba yod mod kyi ;
translated: One has not gone forth through the conditions of poverty.🔽“Ascetic” refers to the asceticism of the tīrthikas.

original: 'dir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yi dam du 'dzin pa la brtul zhugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yi dam du 'dzin pa la brtul zhugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, “ascetic” refers to the vow to maintain the twelve ascetic practices.

original: brtan pas zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba de yang skad cig gam lo zla'i bar du sdom pa blangs te de la gnas pa ma yin gyi na ma 'tsho'i bar du'am snying bo byang chub la thug gi bar du zhes dam @30a * //🔽bcas pa ni brtan pas te /

translated: The phrase firmly means that the renunciate does not take the vows for a moment or for a year or a month, and then abide by them. Rather, he makes the commitment to abide by them for as long as he lives, or until he reaches the heart of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar dang po yi dam bcas pa las slar mi ldog cing mi nur ba ni brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dang po yi dam bcas pa las slar mi ldog cing mi nur ba ni brtan par bya'o //
translated: He should be firm in his commitment, not turning back or wavering from his original vow.

original: sdom pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdom pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of vows:

original: tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / bag bya ba'i yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / bag bya ba'i yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
translated: the branch of morality, the branch of restraint, and the branch of asceticism.

analyzed: de la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo gsum sdom pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: The vow to restrain the three doors of body, speech, and mind is the branch of morality.

original: chang mi 'thung ba ni bag bya ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: chang mi 'thung ba ni bag bya ba'i yan lag go //
translated: The vow not to drink alcohol is the branch of restraint.

original: lhag pa rnams ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: lhag pa rnams ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
translated: The rest are the branch of asceticism.

original: rab bsgrims te zhes pa ni nan tan gyis 'bad pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab bsgrims te zhes pa ni nan tan gyis 'bad pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase with great effort means with earnest effort.

original: yang na dka' thub bslab pa la the tshom dang nem nur med par bslab pa la rim gro bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dka' thub bslab pa la the tshom dang nem nur med par bslab pa la rim gro bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is the respect for the training, without doubt or hesitation, in the matter of the ascetic practices.

original: yang na nyes byas yan chad la 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: yang na nyes byas yan chad la 'dzem pa ste /

translated: If one has all five aspects, one has a root downfall.

original: yan lag gcig dang mi ldan na nyes byas su 'gyur /
analyzed: yan lag gcig dang mi ldan na nyes byas su 'gyur /
translated: If one does not have one of the five aspects, one has a serious violation.

original: de dang po bcas pa ni sangs rgyas yul spre'u rdzing gi ljongs na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dang po bcas pa ni sangs rgyas yul spre'u rdzing gi ljongs na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: The first was established when the Buddha was dwelling in the country of Vārāṇasī.

original: dge slong zhig mi gtsang ba'i bsam gtan bsgoms nas lus mi gtsang bas skyo bar gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong zhig mi gtsang ba'i bsam gtan bsgoms nas lus mi gtsang bas skyo bar gyur te /
translated: A monk cultivated meditation on impurity and became disgusted with his impure body.

original: dge slong dbyug pa can la gsod du bcug pas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong dbyug pa can la gsod du bcug pas bcas so //
translated: He asked a monk named Daṇḍa to kill him, and the Buddha established this precept.

original: brtul zhugs gnas pa zhes pa ni brtul zhugs la gnas pa ni kho nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs gnas pa zhes pa ni brtul zhugs la gnas pa ni kho nas 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase one who is established in the precepts means one who is established in the precepts alone.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa'i don to //
translated: It means one who is established in the vows.🔽The phrase whose mind is not impaired means one whose mind is not impaired in four ways.

original: sems ma nyams pa zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi lta bur sems kyang ma nyams pa ste /🔽gang zhe na 'dre la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sems ma nyams pa zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi lta bur sems kyang ma nyams pa ste / gang zhe na 'dre la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: What are the four?

original: myos par gyur pa dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i las nyams par gyur pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi rnam par @33b smin pa las gyur pa dang / gnad du babs te brgyal nas mi dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myos par gyur pa dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i las nyams par gyur pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi rnam par @33b smin pa las gyur pa dang / gnad du babs te brgyal nas mi dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is possessed by spirits and so on, one who is intoxicated, one whose four great elements are impaired, one who is affected by the ripening of former karma, and one who is unconscious from a blow to the head.

original: ched du bsams te ma nor bar //
analyzed: ched du bsams te ma nor bar //
translated: One who is not impaired by these four is said to have an unimpaired mind.🔽The phrase intentionally and without error means that one must not be impaired by the four conditions of impairment, and one must not be impaired by the four conditions of impairment.

original: zhes pa ni mi de kho na yin gyis zhes te de kho na la dmigs te gsad par yang bsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi de kho na yin gyis zhes te de kho na la dmigs te gsad par yang bsams te /
translated: thinking thus, he focuses on that very person and intends to kill him.

original: gsod sems yang ldan la nor kyang ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: gsod sems yang ldan la nor kyang ma nor ba'o //
translated: He has the thought of killing and he does not make a mistake about the object.

original: mi gzhan bdag gam gzhan rnams kyi ;
analyzed: mi gzhan bdag gam gzhan rnams kyi ;
translated: Another man, oneself or others,

original: / zhes pa ni gsod na sdom pa med par 'gyur bas bdag las gzhan pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni gsod na sdom pa med par 'gyur bas bdag las gzhan pa'i mi'o //
translated: If he kills, he loses the vow. Therefore, the man is other than oneself.

original: de la mi dang mir zin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi dang mir zin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, he is a man and he is taken to be a man.

original: de la mi la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mi la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In this regard, a man is of three types:

original: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning gsum mo //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning gsum mo //
translated: male, female, and neuter.

original: mir zin pa ni mi'i mngal na dbang po gsum dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mir zin pa ni mi'i mngal na dbang po gsum dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: He is taken to be a man when he has three faculties in the human womb:

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po ste gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po ste gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the faculty of life, the mental faculty, and the body faculty.

original: gsod par sbyor ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: gsod par sbyor ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of application to killing:

original: bdag gis bsams pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag gis bsams pa 'am /
translated: one does it oneself or

original: gzhan la bcol te gsod du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bcol te gsod du bcug pa'o //
translated: one engages another to kill.

original: gzhan la bcol ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan la bcol ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Engaging another is of two types:

original: brid pa las dang / mngon sum du bcol ba'o ;
analyzed: brid pa las dang / mngon sum du bcol ba'o ;
translated: one entices him or one engages him directly.

original: / bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: / bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
translated: If you kill him, your vow will be broken.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral na dge tshul gyi sdom pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral na dge tshul gyi sdom pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you deprive him of his life, the novice monk’s vows will be broken.

original: tshul khrims ldan nam zhes pa ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan nam zhes pa ni //
translated: “Are you virtuous?”

original: gsod par byed pa'i tshig ste nad pa 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang bsags /
analyzed: gsod par byed pa'i tshig ste nad pa 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang bsags /
translated: This is the word of the killer. “For the sake of the sick man’s death, you have gathered the accumulations of merit.

original: tshul khrims dang yang ldan pas mtho ris dang thar pa ni dar dang yol bas chod pa tsam gyis myur du shi yang sdig pa mi 'phel gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang yang ldan pas mtho ris dang thar pa ni dar dang yol bas chod pa tsam gyis myur du shi yang sdig pa mi 'phel gyi /
translated: Since you are also virtuous, even if you die quickly, like a curtain or a screen, your sin will not increase.

original: 'chi bar rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
translated: It is right to die.” This is the praise.

original: tshul khrims 'chal zhes pa ni nang pa la khyod kyi tshul khrims ngan pa'i steng du 'dir ji srid de gnas pa de srid sdig pa sog cing 'dug pas dmyal bar yun ring du gnas par 'gyur gyis 'dug par mi rigs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal zhes pa ni nang pa la khyod kyi tshul khrims ngan pa'i steng du 'dir ji srid de gnas pa de srid sdig pa sog cing 'dug pas dmyal bar yun ring du gnas par 'gyur gyis 'dug par mi rigs te /
translated: “You are immoral,” is said to an insider. “On top of your bad morality, you will remain here as long as you live, accumulating sin. Therefore, it is not right to remain.

original: myur du 'chi bar rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa dag smra ba'o //
analyzed: myur du 'chi bar rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa dag smra ba'o //
translated: They praise death, saying, It is right to die quickly!

original: tshig gis gsad par bya ba'i yul gsum ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims ngan pa dang nad pa la'o//
analyzed: tshig gis gsad par bya ba'i yul gsum ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims ngan pa dang nad pa la'o//
translated: There are three objects to be killed by words: those who have moral discipline, those who have bad moral discipline, and the sick.

original: de dag la yo byad sdu gu bdog pa de 'dod pa'i phyir de dag la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod de //
analyzed: de dag la yo byad sdu gu bdog pa de 'dod pa'i phyir de dag la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod de //
translated: Because they want the possessions of those who have good possessions, they praise death to them.

original: des shi na dom pa zhig go //
analyzed: des shi na dom pa zhig go //
translated: If they die because of that, it is a serious offense.

original: de las bzlog pa las shi 'am ma shi yang rung ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa las shi 'am ma shi yang rung ste /
translated: If they do not die, or if they die in a different way,

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la //
translated: Likewise, to those who are sick🔽who are suffering and unwell

original: zhes pa ni nad kyis sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar 'dug pa @34a * //🔽la shi na nad 'di dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nad kyis sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar 'dug pa @34a * // la shi na nad 'di dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because of illness,🔽if they die because of praising death, saying, “You will be free from this illness,”

original: 'chi ba'i rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod cing mtshon byin nam mtshon thogs pa gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod cing mtshon byin nam mtshon thogs pa gnyer ba'o //
translated: or if they die by giving them a weapon or by seeking someone to kill them,🔽it is a serious offense.

original: nad pa bslang pa la des dbugs bcad de shi ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nad pa bslang pa la des dbugs bcad de shi ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If they die by being deprived of breath by the sick person, there is no offense.

original: gang thos zhes pa ni de ltar de gsum la gang dang gang thos pa'o //
analyzed: gang thos zhes pa ni de ltar de gsum la gang dang gang thos pa'o //
translated: As for whatever is heard, it is whatever is heard from those three.

original: sdug bsngal nyam thag ste zhes pa ni tshul khrims ngan pa yang ngan song gi rgyu yin pas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyam thag ste zhes pa ni tshul khrims ngan pa yang ngan song gi rgyu yin pas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: As for distressed by suffering, it is suffering because bad ethics are also a cause of the lower realms.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang da ltar lus la sdug bsngal bar blta'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang da ltar lus la sdug bsngal bar blta'o //
translated: Even those with ethics should be seen as suffering in their present bodies.

original: nad pa ni 'phral du nyam thag go //
analyzed: nad pa ni 'phral du nyam thag go //
translated: The sick are immediately distressed.

original: nges 'chi'i chos gtam der mi bya //🔽zhes pa ni nges pa'am gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gtam nad pa dag la mi bya'o //
analyzed: nges 'chi'i chos gtam der mi bya // zhes pa ni nges pa'am gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gtam nad pa dag la mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak to them about the Dharma of certain death.

original: sman dang zhes pa ni nad pa dang mi mthun pa 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi sbyin no //
analyzed: sman dang zhes pa ni nad pa dang mi mthun pa 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi sbyin no //
translated: As for medicine, one should not give what is incompatible with the sick person's condition, which would lead to death.

original: de la 'chi ba'i sman ni dper na rkun po lag pa gcad pa mi drug cu la dge slong mas rtsab mo lan tshva can gyi byin pas rkun po na ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'chi ba'i sman ni dper na rkun po lag pa gcad pa mi drug cu la dge slong mas rtsab mo lan tshva can gyi byin pas rkun po na ba lta bu'o //

original: rtsa ba mo lan tshva can ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba mo lan tshva can ni /
translated: The radish with salt

original: rgya gar gyi skad kyis kanydzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi skad kyis kanydzin zhes bya'o //
translated: is called kanyaja in the language of India.

original: khams mi mnyam pa dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman ci yang rung ste mi sbyin no //
analyzed: khams mi mnyam pa dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman ci yang rung ste mi sbyin no //
translated: I will not give any medicine that is not suitable or that does not agree with the humours.🔽Mantras are secret mantras for abhicāraka.🔽Vidyā is mundane and supramundane knowledge.

original: sngags dang zhes pa ni gsang sngags aa bhi tsa ra ste /🔽mngon spyod pa'o //🔽rig pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pa ste /🔽de la 'jig rten pa'i rig pa ni mu stegs can nam bram ze'i rig pa'o //

translated: Mundane knowledge is the knowledge of tīrthikas and brahmins.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pas ni sangs rgyas pa'i rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pas ni sangs rgyas pa'i rig pa ste /
translated: Supramundane knowledge is the knowledge of Buddhists.

original: rig pa de gnyis gang yang rung bas pha rol la gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa de gnyis gang yang rung bas pha rol la gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: One should not cause harm to others by either of these two kinds of knowledge.

translated: or to a place with poisonous scorpions,🔽or to

original: ra ro ba g-yang sa phyogs su btang ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: ra ro ba g-yang sa phyogs su btang ba la sogs pas te /
translated: By means of intoxication, sending to a place with an abyss, and so on.

original: 'chi bar bsgrub pa'i gnas su btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar bsgrub pa'i gnas su btang ba'o //
translated: By means of sending to a place that is a means of accomplishing death.

original: mi gzhan zhes pa ni bdag bsad pa la sngom pa zhig par mi 'gyur bas gzhan mi yin pa'i mi gzhan dag go //
analyzed: mi gzhan zhes pa ni bdag bsad pa la sngom pa zhig par mi 'gyur bas gzhan mi yin pa'i mi gzhan dag go //
translated: Other men means other men who are not oneself, because one's own murder would not be a vow-violation.

original: thabs sna tshogs kyis zhes pa ni gong du smos par zad do //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs kyis zhes pa ni gong du smos par zad do //
translated: By means of various methods refers to what was mentioned above.

original: dug dang gtor ma 'dzol dang sa mda' la sogs pas 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs 'di lta bu sna tshogs kyis brdas kyang rung rtsas mgo dang @34b sbyar te de la rtsis mgo tshang ba mang yang lci yang yod de /
analyzed: dug dang gtor ma 'dzol dang sa mda' la sogs pas 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs 'di lta bu sna tshogs kyis brdas kyang rung rtsas mgo dang @34b sbyar te de la rtsis mgo tshang ba mang yang lci yang yod de /
translated: By means of various methods such as poison, oblation, sorcery, and so on, or by means of various signs such as the head and so on, there are many complete heads of calculation, but there is weight and lightness.

original: gsod sems dang mi ldan pa la rtsis mgo gzhan dang ldan kyang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsod sems dang mi ldan pa la rtsis mgo gzhan dang ldan kyang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lacks the intention to kill, even though one has another head of calculation, it becomes a minor fault.

original: gsod sems dang ldan pa la ma shi ba ni nyes byas sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsod sems dang ldan pa la ma shi ba ni nyes byas sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has the intention to kill, but the person does not die, it becomes a serious fault.

original: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
translated: If one kills, one's discipline degenerates.

original: zhes pa ni srog bcad pa tsam gyis sdom pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni srog bcad pa tsam gyis sdom pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: By merely killing a living being, the vow is damaged.

original: mi bsad pa 'ba' zhig gis sdom pa zhig par 'gyur ro //🔽'di man chad ci zhig gis las su byas nas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mi bsad pa 'ba' zhig gis sdom pa zhig par 'gyur ro // 'di man chad ci zhig gis las su byas nas kyang rung ste /
translated: By killing a human being alone, the vow is destroyed.🔽From here on, whatever action is done, it is not suitable to be a novice monk.

original: dge tshul du mi rung bar mi 'gyur bas gong ma las bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge tshul du mi rung bar mi 'gyur bas gong ma las bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished from the above.

original: byol song dang ni zhes pa ni bde 'gro las byol te /
analyzed: byol song dang ni zhes pa ni bde 'gro las byol te /
translated: As for animal, it is excluded from the happy realms.

original: ngan 'gro'i gnas su skyes pa klu man chad dang / grog sbur yan chad do //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i gnas su skyes pa klu man chad dang / grog sbur yan chad do //
translated: It is born in the abode of the lower realms, from nāgas and below, up to ants.

original: sems dmyal dang zhes pa ni dmyal ba chen por ma phyin kyang so so re re'i dmyal bas te /
analyzed: sems dmyal dang zhes pa ni dmyal ba chen por ma phyin kyang so so re re'i dmyal bas te /
translated: As for hell being, even if one has not gone to the great hells, it is the individual hells.

original: dper na rgya mtshor song song ba las /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtshor song song ba las /
translated: For example, as if going to the ocean,

original: rgya mtsho'i gling na dmyal dang phrad //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i gling na dmyal dang phrad //
translated: one encounters a hell on an island in the ocean.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: yi dags zhes pa ni phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre yang chad do //
analyzed: yi dags zhes pa ni phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre yang chad do //
translated: As for hungry ghost, it also excludes the ghosts of discarded rags.

original: 'on te lha yang rung zhes pa ni shing lha yan chad nas 'go min gyi gnas kyi lha'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'on te lha yang rung zhes pa ni shing lha yan chad nas 'go min gyi gnas kyi lha'i bar du'o //
translated: Or even a god, means from the tree-spirit up to the gods of the Highest Heaven.

original: bsad na ngan song lhung ba'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsad na ngan song lhung ba'i zhes pa ni /
translated: If one kills them, one falls into the lower realms.

original: byol song nas lha'i bar du de dag bsad na ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
analyzed: byol song nas lha'i bar du de dag bsad na ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
translated: If one kills those from the animals up to the gods, one falls into the three lower realms.

original: sdig pa spom po thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa spom po thob par 'gyur //
translated: One obtains a grave sin.

original: zhes pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul khrims las thal byung du blangs pas sbom po zhes smos kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul khrims las thal byung du blangs pas sbom po zhes smos kyi /
translated: This is called “grave” because one has taken it up in excess of the morality of a monk.

original: dge tshul la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge tshul la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: But for a novice monk, it is a minor offense.

original: brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
translated: If one who is observing vows thinks, “I will kill,”

original: zhes pa ni sngom pa la gnas pas mi la sogs pa gsod par sems pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngom pa la gnas pas mi la sogs pa gsod par sems pas so //
translated: this means that one who is observing vows thinks of killing a human being, and so on.

original: lus dang zhes pa ni lus kyis mda' 'phangs pa dang ral gri dang mdung la sogs pas 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang zhes pa ni lus kyis mda' 'phangs pa dang ral gri dang mdung la sogs pas 'debs pa'o //
translated: With the body means that one shoots an arrow with the body, or strikes with a sword, a spear, and so on.

original: ngag gis bshams pa las zhes pa ni ngag gis 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis bshams pa las zhes pa ni ngag gis 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: With speech means that one praises death with speech, and so on.

original: skye bo gson yang de la ni //
analyzed: skye bo gson yang de la ni //

analyzed: zhes pa ni de skad ces de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal to //

original: gal te sbrul gyis bsad gyur kyang //
analyzed: gal te sbrul gyis bsad gyur kyang //

analyzed: zhes pa ni sbrul gdug pa'i khar bcug nas 'chi ste 'chi bar gyur kyang ngo //

analyzed: tshul khrims gnas la de phan te //
translated: He benefits from observing morality.

original: zhes pa ni des shi na yang tshul khrims mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni des shi na yang tshul khrims mi 'jig ste /
translated: Even if he dies, his morality is not destroyed.

analyzed: med pas med 'gyur bas mtho ris su skyes pas na de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is reborn in the higher realms due to the absence of morality, that is called benefit.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa sdug bsngal yin //

original: zhes pa ni chos la gnas pas myur du bdag shi bla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos la gnas pas myur du bdag shi bla'o //

original: chos la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'ang cir mi rung //
analyzed: chos la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'ang cir mi rung //

original: chos gnas sum cu rtsa gsum lha yi bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: chos gnas sum cu rtsa gsum lha yi bde ba 'thob //
translated: One who abides in the Dharma attains the bliss of the thirty-three gods.

analyzed: chos thob bral ba myur du ngan song 'jigs ltung ngo //

analyzed: khyim bdag de na phas mi rgod brgyad cu la smra ba de lta bu ste /

original: tshul khrims med pa de ni sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims med pa de ni sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: The absence of morality is suffering.

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is an obstacle to nirvana.

analyzed: de lta bas na tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa'i dge sbyor ni khang pa phug rdol can mes tshig pa'i mgal dum dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, the spiritual practice of one who lacks morality is like a house with a hole in it, burning with fire, and with a pile of straw.

original: mya ngan 'das la sgrib par 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la sgrib par 'gyur //
translated: It is an obstacle to nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also an obstacle to nirvana.

analyzed: de 'khor ba'i yan lag thams cad la yang mi tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya'o //

original: mdor @38b na sems byang ba'i thabs tsam du gsungs so //
analyzed: mdor @38b na sems byang ba'i thabs tsam du gsungs so //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: lus kyis dpyad du med na yid kyis brtags pa mang du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di yan chad du mi tshangs par spyod pa'i bshad pa 'das so /

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: yan lag gcig dang mi ldan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag gcig dang mi ldan na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la dang po bcas pa ni sangs rgyas yul yangs pa can gyi 'od ma'i grong 'dab na bzhugs pa'i tshe /

analyzed: gang na bdag 'dug lha'o zhes pa ni nga gang na bar lha dag 'ong zhes zer ba'o //

analyzed: mthong zhing zhes pa ni bdag gis lha mthong ba dang / lhas kyang bdag mthong zhes pa'o //

analyzed: de'i sgra zhes pa ni gcig gi sgra gcig gis thos pa'o //

analyzed: bdag kyang de dag gam 'gro dang // zhes ba ni nga lha'i gan du 'gro'o zhes zer ba'o //

translated: Mahakinnara means

translated: The higher perceptions are

analyzed: ma nyams zhes pa ni mi dran par yang ma gyur te /
translated: As for without having degenerated, it is not to be forgotten.

original: sems nyams pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyams pa'o //
translated: It is the degeneration of the mind.

analyzed: smras na sdom pa nyams par 'gyur //

analyzed: 'di man chad ni sdom pa zhig par mi 'gyur ba'i yan lag ston to //

analyzed: zhes pa ni de dag smras na bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel te /
translated: If one says these things, non-meritoriousness increases greatly.

original: des ngan song du ni khrid par byed la sdom pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ngan song du ni khrid par byed la sdom pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one is led to the lower realms, but the vow is not destroyed.

original: des ni 'og mar ltung bar byed //
analyzed: des ni 'og mar ltung bar byed //
translated: By that, one falls to the lower realms.

original: ces pa ni shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smras pa des ni mi las 'og ma gsum du ltung bar byed do /
analyzed: ces pa ni shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smras pa des ni mi las 'og ma gsum du ltung bar byed do /
translated: By that, one falls to the three lower realms from the human realm.

original: // / 'di man chad ni phra mo'i nyes pa 'chad de /
analyzed: // / 'di man chad ni phra mo'i nyes pa 'chad de /
translated: From here on, the minor faults are explained.

original: ji ltar mdza' bod bye 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: ji ltar mdza' bod bye 'gyur ba'i //
translated: How does one become an enemy?

original: zhes pa ni mi gnyis yid mthun zhing mdza' ba da la thabs gang gis dbye bar 'gyur ba'i tshig 'og ma lta bu'i tshig smras so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi gnyis yid mthun zhing mdza' ba da la thabs gang gis dbye bar 'gyur ba'i tshig 'og ma lta bu'i tshig smras so //
translated: This is the kind of speech that causes division between two people who are in agreement and friendly.

original: phra ma'i tshig rnams smra mi bya //
analyzed: phra ma'i tshig rnams smra mi bya //
translated: One should not speak divisive words.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis dbye ba'i phyir tshig bden pa yang rung brdzun pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis dbye ba'i phyir tshig bden pa yang rung brdzun pa yang rung ste /
translated: This means that, whether true or false, one should not speak words that divide others through hatred.

original: phan tshun bskyal zhing smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bskyal zhing smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak words that divide others through hatred.

original: phra ma la rnam pa gnyis te zhe sdang gis dbye ba dang / phan par bya ba'i phyir dbye ba ste /
analyzed: phra ma la rnam pa gnyis te zhe sdang gis dbye ba dang / phan par bya ba'i phyir dbye ba ste /
translated: There are two types of divisive speech: that which divides others through hatred and that which divides others for the sake of benefit.

original: de la phan par bya ba'i phyir dbye ba'i phra ma zer pa ni nyes par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de la phan par bya ba'i phyir dbye ba'i phra ma zer pa ni nyes par mi gzhag go //
translated: Among them, divisive speech for the sake of benefit is not considered a fault.

original: 'di dag ni dge tshul gyi khrims kyi dngos po ma yin mod @40a * //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dge tshul gyi khrims kyi dngos po ma yin mod @40a * //
translated: These are not the actual precepts of a novice monk.

original: kyi ; ngag gi nyes pa spang ba'i skabs su dge ba bcu'i rgyud kyis bsdams nas ngag gi skyon 'di dag spang bar bstan to //
analyzed: kyi ; ngag gi nyes pa spang ba'i skabs su dge ba bcu'i rgyud kyis bsdams nas ngag gi skyon 'di dag spang bar bstan to //
translated: However, in the context of abandoning verbal faults, by the continuity of the ten virtues, these faults of speech are taught to be abandoned.

original: thun tshags su ni smra ba dang // zhes bya ba 'di tshig rkang 'dis thun tshags su smra ba 'chad de /
analyzed: thun tshags su ni smra ba dang // zhes bya ba 'di tshig rkang 'dis thun tshags su smra ba 'chad de /
translated: Speaking in a roundabout way, this line explains speaking in a roundabout way.

original: dgos pa'i don med par sgrung gtam dang / lde'u dang ; glu tshig dang / snyan ngag dang / gar dang / bre mo gtam dang / bon smra ba la sogs pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don med par sgrung gtam dang / lde'u dang ; glu tshig dang / snyan ngag dang / gar dang / bre mo gtam dang / bon smra ba la sogs pa smras pa'o //
translated: Without a necessary reason, one should not speak of stories, of genealogies, of songs, of poetry, of dances, of idle talk, of the Bon doctrine, etc.

original: tshig rtsub smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak harshly.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol zhes 'de bas pa'i tshig dag smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol zhes 'de bas pa'i tshig dag smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak words which wound the heart of another.

original: 'di man chad ni dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi ston te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi ston te /
translated: From here on, the four rules of the Sramana are taught.

original: de la dge sbyong du gyur tam /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong du gyur tam /
translated: What is a Sramana?

original: dge sbyong zhes bya ba de thob nas 'di dag bsrung dgos so //
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bya ba de thob nas 'di dag bsrung dgos so //
translated: Having obtained the name of Sramana, one should observe these rules.

original: ngan du zer la'ang ngan mi brjod //
analyzed: ngan du zer la'ang ngan mi brjod //
translated: One should not return abuse for abuse.

original: ces bya ba ni pha rol tshig ngan pa pha'i sha zo zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i tshig ngan pa zer yang tshul 'di'i lan tshig ngan pa'i bag zur yang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni pha rol tshig ngan pa pha'i sha zo zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i tshig ngan pa zer yang tshul 'di'i lan tshig ngan pa'i bag zur yang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: If another, in anger, says to him, “Eat your father’s flesh,” etc., he should not return the abuse.

original: gshe la lan du slar mi gshe //
analyzed: gshe la lan du slar mi gshe //
translated: One should not return anger for anger.

original: zhes bya ba ni phas tshur bdag la ngan pa 'di zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ngan pas brgyad bkag kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phas tshur bdag la ngan pa 'di zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ngan pas brgyad bkag kyang /
translated: This means that even if others come and block you with harsh words such as “You are a bad person,”

original: de'i lan gshe ba'i tshig dag kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lan gshe ba'i tshig dag kyang mi bya'o //
translated: you should not respond with words of abuse.🔽Do not expose the faults of others in return for their exposing your faults.🔽This means that even if others expose your faults, you should not expose even the slightest fault of theirs in return.

original: mtshang 'bru ba la slar mi 'bru //🔽zhes pa ni phas tshur bdag la skyon ci yod pa'i bag mtshang 'bru ba de la slar de'i mtshang 'bru bag tsam yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshang 'bru ba la slar mi 'bru // zhes pa ni phas tshur bdag la skyon ci yod pa'i bag mtshang 'bru ba de la slar de'i mtshang 'bru bag tsam yang mi bya'o //
translated: Do not strike in return for being struck.

original: rdeg pa la yang slar mi rdeg / ces bya ba ni phas tshur mtshon cha dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa dag gis bdag la brdeg kyang de'i lan du rdul tsam mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa la yang slar mi rdeg / ces bya ba ni phas tshur mtshon cha dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa dag gis bdag la brdeg kyang de'i lan du rdul tsam mi bya'o //
translated: This means that even if others strike you with weapons, sticks, and so on, you should not respond with even the slightest bit of anger.🔽The wise,

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni blo dang shes rab dang rig pa dang rtogs pa dag ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni blo dang shes rab dang rig pa dang rtogs pa dag ni rnam grangs te /
translated: means that intelligence, wisdom, knowledge, and realization are synonyms.

original: mdor na shes rab dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na shes rab dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In brief, it means possessing wisdom.🔽Those who desire the training,

original: bslab pa 'dod pa yis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i bslab pa'am /
analyzed: bslab pa 'dod pa yis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i bslab pa'am /
translated: means those who desire the training taught by the Tathāgata.

original: tshul khrims de la dad pas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims de la dad pas so //
translated: By means of faith in that morality.

original: bsgrims te zhes bya ba shin tu nan tan du 'bad do //
analyzed: bsgrims te zhes bya ba shin tu nan tan du 'bad do //
translated: With effort means with intense exertion.

original: dag gi skyon rnams spang zhes pa ni pha rol po'i yid mi dga' bar gyur na bdag kyang des dmyal bdag tu khrid par byad pas skyon te /
analyzed: dag gi skyon rnams spang zhes pa ni pha rol po'i yid mi dga' bar gyur na bdag kyang des dmyal bdag tu khrid par byad pas skyon te /
translated: Avoiding the faults of speech means that if the mind of the other person becomes displeased, then oneself is led by that to hell.

original: de bas na ngag gi skyon rnams spang bar bya ba thams cad las byung bas na dang po ngag gi nyes pa bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ngag gi skyon rnams spang bar bya ba thams cad las byung bas na dang po ngag gi nyes pa bsdam par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should restrain the faults of speech, since all faults arise from speech.

original: de ltar 'gyur bar rig nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bar rig nas ni //
translated: Having understood it in that way,

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar ngag de'i nyes pa bzhi ni bshad da 'das so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar ngag de'i nyes pa bzhi ni bshad da 'das so /
translated: means that the four faults of speech have been explained in that way.

original: // / da ni lnga ba la bab ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lnga ba la bab ste /
translated: Now, the fifth is relevant.

original: chang mi btung ba 'chad do //
analyzed: chang mi btung ba 'chad do //
translated: Not drinking alcohol is explained.

original: 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //🔽zhes bya @40b ba ni sa bon btab nas lo tog las skyes pa'i gro nas dang 'bras la sogs pa kun bsdus te /
analyzed: 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi // zhes bya @40b ba ni sa bon btab nas lo tog las skyes pa'i gro nas dang 'bras la sogs pa kun bsdus te /
translated: The one mixed with grain and yeast

original: lo tog las btags pa'i chang ste /
analyzed: lo tog las btags pa'i chang ste /
translated: means that having planted seeds, the one mixed with grain and yeast is the alcohol that arises from the harvest, such as wheat, rice, and so on.

original: zan chang lta bu phabs dang sbyar ba chang du yang gyur /
analyzed: zan chang lta bu phabs dang sbyar ba chang du yang gyur /
translated: For example, a mixture of flour and yeast becomes alcohol.

original: chang du yang 'du shes /
analyzed: chang du yang 'du shes /
translated: One perceives it as alcohol.

original: bdag gis kyang 'thungs /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'thungs /
translated: One drinks it.

original: myos par yang 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: myos par yang 'gyur na'o //
translated: One becomes intoxicated.

original: btung ba'i bye brag 'bru yi chang ;
analyzed: btung ba'i bye brag 'bru yi chang ;
translated: The different kinds of drinks are grain alcohol,

original: / zhes bya ba ni chang gi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni chang gi rnam grangs te /
translated: which is a synonym for alcohol.

original: rkun 'brum dang / bur ma spang rtsi las chang du byas pa dang / me tog dang lo tog thams cad kyi chang ngo //
analyzed: rkun 'brum dang / bur ma spang rtsi las chang du byas pa dang / me tog dang lo tog thams cad kyi chang ngo //
translated: It is made from fermented honey, sugar cane, or flowers and fruits.

original: de la chang la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la chang la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of alcohol:

original: kha dog gi chang dang / dri'i chang dang / ro'i chang dang / mchu chang gi dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: kha dog gi chang dang / dri'i chang dang / ro'i chang dang / mchu chang gi dang bzhi'o //
translated: colored alcohol, fragrant alcohol, flavored alcohol, and intoxicating alcohol.

original: de la mthu dang mi ldan par 'thungs pas ni nyes byas la brtsi'o //
analyzed: de la mthu dang mi ldan par 'thungs pas ni nyes byas la brtsi'o //
translated: If one drinks alcohol that is not intoxicating, it is considered a minor offense.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa mang du 'chad de /🔽rgya gar skad kyis par ma 'thungs na nyes pa'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa mang du 'chad de / rgya gar skad kyis par ma 'thungs na nyes pa'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: There are many other explanations.🔽In the Indian language, it is explained as “if one drinks beer, it is an offense.”

original: yang ro can mi btung ste 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: yang ro can mi btung ste 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes 'chad do //
translated: It is also explained that one should not drink alcohol that has a taste, and if one drinks it, it is a minor offense.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni bu ram shing gi chang dag go //
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni bu ram shing gi chang dag go //
translated: The term “stem” refers to the juice of sugarcane.

original: me tog gang zhes bya ba ni sbrang chang dag go ;
analyzed: me tog gang zhes bya ba ni sbrang chang dag go ;
translated: The term “flower” refers to honey wine.

original: /'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni rgun chang dag bsdu'o //🔽sbyar ba'i khu ba 'bras bu'i chang //
analyzed: /'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni rgun chang dag bsdu'o // sbyar ba'i khu ba 'bras bu'i chang //
translated: The term “fruit” refers to grape wine.🔽The term “mixture” refers to wine made from rice and other grains.🔽The term “fermented” refers to wine made from molasses.

original: zhes bya ba ni phabs dang sbyar ba'i chang ngo //🔽des ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phabs dang sbyar ba'i chang ngo // des ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
translated: The term “distilled” refers to wine made from flowers and fruits.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgya gar gyi skad du mar ta zhes bya ste /🔽bar ma dang sbyor bar 'gyur ba kun mi snang ste /🔽de la mdor bsdus te smras pa'o //🔽sdom can phan 'dod mi btung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgya gar gyi skad du mar ta zhes bya ste / bar ma dang sbyor bar 'gyur ba kun mi snang ste / de la mdor bsdus te smras pa'o // sdom can phan 'dod mi btung ngo //
translated: The term “intoxicant” refers to the Indian word madya.🔽The term “should not drink” refers to the Indian word na pibet.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la gnas pa bdag la phan par 'dod pas gong du smras pa'i chang de dag mi btung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la gnas pa bdag la phan par 'dod pas gong du smras pa'i chang de dag mi btung ngo //
translated: The term “one who is restrained” refers to one who is established in morality.🔽The term “one who desires his own welfare” refers to one who desires his own benefit.

original: de 'thungs nas ni zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: de 'thungs nas ni zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na ci nyes she na /
translated: The term “if he drinks” refers to the Indian word yadi pibet.

original: gong ma ltar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong ma ltar du 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “he will be like the above” refers to the Indian word yathā pūrvam.

original: dran pa nyams na zhes bya ba ni myos pa'i blor 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dran pa nyams na zhes bya ba ni myos pa'i blor 'gyur ro ;
translated: If he loses his mindfulness, he becomes confused.

original: / brtul zhugs ldan pa bag med 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni sdom pa la zhugs pa /🔽sdom pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: / brtul zhugs ldan pa bag med 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni sdom pa la zhugs pa / sdom pa la gnas pa /
translated: He who is endowed with the vow becomes heedless.

original: sdom pa dang ldan pa de tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa dang ldan pa de tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: He who is endowed with the vow, who has undertaken the vow, who is established in the vow, who possesses the vow, his morality is destroyed.

original: dper na chung ba dge bsnyen cig la rkyal bya ba'i phyir chang rdze'u gang dang lug cig bud med cig khrid de 'ongs pa las chang 'thungs pa dang khrims lnga char dral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chung ba dge bsnyen cig la rkyal bya ba'i phyir chang rdze'u gang dang lug cig bud med cig khrid de 'ongs pa las chang 'thungs pa dang khrims lnga char dral ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a certain upasaka, a novice, came to a river with a jar of beer, a sheep, and a woman, in order to make love. He drank the beer and broke all five of his precepts.

original: bag med pa las brtul zhugs nyams //
analyzed: bag med pa las brtul zhugs nyams //
translated: He who is heedless loses his vow.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong ma bsnan te smras pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong ma bsnan te smras pa tsam du zad do //
translated: This is said by way of adding to the above.

original: yang na tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag dang gsum lus dang ngag gis bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag dang gsum lus dang ngag gis bsrung ba ste /
translated: Or else, there are three parts to morality: the part of morality, the part of the vow, and the part of the vow of the ascetic.

original: pham pa'i gzhi ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag @41a * //
analyzed: pham pa'i gzhi ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag @41a * //
translated: The basis of defeat is the part of morality.

original: go ; / glu gar dag ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: go ; / glu gar dag ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag ste /
translated: Song and dance are the part of the vow of the ascetic.

original: khyim pa las khyad par du bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa las khyad par du bya'o //
translated: One should be distinguished from the householders.

original: de bas ston pa'i bka' dran bya //
analyzed: de bas ston pa'i bka' dran bya //
translated: Therefore, one should remember the words of the Teacher.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas de phyin ci ma log par ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas de phyin ci ma log par ston pa'o //
translated: This is the Buddha's teaching without error.

original: de bas na ji skad gsungs she na /
analyzed: de bas na ji skad gsungs she na /
translated: Therefore, how is it said?

original: chang ni nyes dgu mtshon pa ste //
analyzed: chang ni nyes dgu mtshon pa ste //
translated: Alcohol is the weapon of the nine faults,

original: bag chags bsgribs pas rnal 'byor nyams //
analyzed: bag chags bsgribs pas rnal 'byor nyams //
translated: Obscured by traces, the yogi is ruined.

original: zhes bkag pas na de'i bka' dran par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bkag pas na de'i bka' dran par gzhag go //
translated: Since it is prohibited, one should remember his words.

original: myos 'gyur nyes pa 'phel 'gyur ba //
analyzed: myos 'gyur nyes pa 'phel 'gyur ba //
translated: The fault of intoxication increases,

original: zhes bya ba ni chang 'thungs pas myos pa tsam du ma zad kyi nyes pa gzhan yang mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chang 'thungs pas myos pa tsam du ma zad kyi nyes pa gzhan yang mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Not only is one intoxicated by drinking alcohol, but many other faults increase.

original: rtsa mchog tsam yang mi btung ngo //
analyzed: rtsa mchog tsam yang mi btung ngo //
translated: One should not drink even a drop.

original: de bas na rtsa'i thor to la chags pa tsam yang mi btung na mang du 'thungs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de bas na rtsa'i thor to la chags pa tsam yang mi btung na mang du 'thungs pa lta ci smos /
translated: Therefore, if one should not drink even a drop attached to the tip of a hair, what need is there to mention drinking much?

original: da 'di man chad dge tshul gyi bslab tshigs bcu'i dngos po la lnga ni 'das /
analyzed: da 'di man chad dge tshul gyi bslab tshigs bcu'i dngos po la lnga ni 'das /
translated: From here on, the five of the ten precepts of the novice monk have passed.

original: da ni drug pa la bab ste /
analyzed: da ni drug pa la bab ste /
translated: Now, the sixth has arrived.

original: glu gar mi bya bar 'chad do //
analyzed: glu gar mi bya bar 'chad do //
translated: It is explained that one should not sing or dance.

original: glu gar de bzhin sil snyan rnams //
analyzed: glu gar de bzhin sil snyan rnams //
translated: Singing, dancing, and likewise musical instruments,

original: zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i spyad dang rol mo bya ba thams cad bsrung ba ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i spyad dang rol mo bya ba thams cad bsrung ba ste ;
translated: This is the protection of all musical instruments and musical activities.

original: bdag nyid kyang mi bya /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mi bya /
translated: One should not play oneself,

original: gzhan byed du yang mi gzhug / bdag nyid nyan pa'i phyir na dkon mchog gi spyan sngar byed du yang mi gzhug / bdag nyan pa'i phyir ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan byed du yang mi gzhug / bdag nyid nyan pa'i phyir na dkon mchog gi spyan sngar byed du yang mi gzhug / bdag nyan pa'i phyir ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor should one cause others to play, nor should one cause to be played in front of the Jewels for the sake of one's own hearing.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i phyir ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i phyir ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in playing for the sake of making offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: dril bu dkrol ba dang dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dril bu dkrol ba dang dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in ringing a bell for the sake of making offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: chu la bye'u zul byed pa la sogs pa chu la rtse ba sna tshogs kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu la bye'u zul byed pa la sogs pa chu la rtse ba sna tshogs kyang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not play in water, such as swimming and various water games.

original: rkyal mi shes na dben par bslab pa dang sman pas bsgos te /
analyzed: rkyal mi shes na dben par bslab pa dang sman pas bsgos te /
translated: If one does not know how to swim, one should train in a secluded place, and if one is sick,

original: sman gyi cho gas chu'i nang du rgyal ba dag la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sman gyi cho gas chu'i nang du rgyal ba dag la nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in swimming in the water for the sake of medicine.

original: glu'i dbyangs thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: glu'i dbyangs thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sing any songs.

original: chos 'chad pa dang yi ge klog pa dang ; dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa'i tshe dbyangs len pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa dang yi ge klog pa dang ; dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa'i tshe dbyangs len pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in chanting when teaching the Dharma, reading the scriptures, or praising the Three Jewels.

original: sdom pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: One who is established in the vow should not do this.

original: bslab tshigs bcu'i dngos po las de yan chad drug ni 'das /
analyzed: bslab tshigs bcu'i dngos po las de yan chad drug ni 'das /
translated: The first six of the ten precepts have been explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la gnas pas mal dag bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la gnas pas mal dag bya'o //
translated: This means that one who is established in the training should prepare the bed.

original: rkang lag bkru'o //
analyzed: rkang lag bkru'o //
translated: One should wash one's feet.

original: srod tho rangs kyi dge ba dag 'tshal lo zhes da dag kun zhu'o //
analyzed: srod tho rangs kyi dge ba dag 'tshal lo zhes da dag kun zhu'o //
translated: One should ask about the good deeds of the evening and the morning.

original: rkang pa gnyi ka bkrus nas ni //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyi ka bkrus nas ni //
translated: One should wash both feet.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rkang ba bkru bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rkang ba bkru bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should wash one's own feet.

original: nam gyi cha stod cha smad la //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod cha smad la //
translated: In the first and last watches of the night,

original: zhe bya ba ni mtshan gcig la thun bzhir bgos pa'i thun dang po dang tha ma gnyis so //
analyzed: zhe bya ba ni mtshan gcig la thun bzhir bgos pa'i thun dang po dang tha ma gnyis so //
translated: This means the first and last of the four periods into which one night is divided.

original: yang na srod dang tho rangs gnyis so //
analyzed: yang na srod dang tho rangs gnyis so //
translated: Or it means the evening and the morning.

original: bsgrims te mi nyal bya ba ste //
analyzed: bsgrims te mi nyal bya ba ste //
translated: One should be diligent and not sleep.

original: zhes bya ba ni ltag tu smos pa de dag la bsgrims te mi nyal bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ltag tu smos pa de dag la bsgrims te mi nyal bar bgyi'o //
translated: This means that one should be diligent and not sleep in the periods mentioned above.

original: des ni bden par smra bar bya //
analyzed: des ni bden par smra bar bya //
translated: One should speak the truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhus pa de bzhin du bsgrims te byas na ni brdzun du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhus pa de bzhin du bsgrims te byas na ni brdzun du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is the meaning: if one acts in accordance with the request, it is not a lie.

original: ji skad du zhus pa de bzhin du ma byas na shes bzhin gyi brdzun yang byas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du zhus pa de bzhin du ma byas na shes bzhin gyi brdzun yang byas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: But if one does not act in accordance with the request, then one has committed a lie with full awareness.

original: ldang dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis //🔽zhes bya ba ni nam 'di tsam na ldang ngo zhes nam gyi mtshan ma yid la snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: ldang dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis // zhes bya ba ni nam 'di tsam na ldang ngo zhes nam gyi mtshan ma yid la snang bar byas nas /
translated: With the perception of rising and of light.

original: de kho na'i dus su sang par 'gyur ba'i phyir ldang dang snang ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i dus su sang par 'gyur ba'i phyir ldang dang snang ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya'o //
translated: One should bring to mind the signs of rising and of light at the time when one will rise.🔽At that very time, it is morning.

original: seng ge'i nyal thabs bzhin du bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gcan gzan gyi rgyal po seng ge lag pa g-yas pa 'og tu bcug ste nyal ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: seng ge'i nyal thabs bzhin du bya // zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gcan gzan gyi rgyal po seng ge lag pa g-yas pa 'og tu bcug ste nyal ba de bzhin du /
translated: One should lie down like a lion.🔽Just as the king of beasts, the lion, lies down placing his right foreleg close to his forechest,

original: lag pa g-yas pa 'gram pa'i 'og tu bcar te /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa 'gram pa'i 'og tu bcar te /
translated: in the same way one should lie down on one’s right side, placing one’s right hand on one’s cheek.

original: g-yas phyogs su nyal ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su nyal ba'o //
translated: One should lie down on one’s right side.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa dag gi g-yon phyogs su nyal bas /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa dag gi g-yon phyogs su nyal bas /
translated: For those who practice with passion, lying on one’s left side.

original: 'dod chags spang bar sbyor ba kun g-yas phyogs kyis nyal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags spang bar sbyor ba kun g-yas phyogs kyis nyal ba'i phyir /
translated: One lies on the right side in order to apply oneself to abandoning attachment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang de lta bu'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang de lta bu'i tshul du'o //
translated: One should lie on the right side, in the manner of the Tathagata's nirvana, in order to apply oneself to the abandonment of passion.

original: dran dang ldan zhing dge rgyud dang // zhes bya ba ni de ltar dran pa dang ldan par byas nas nyal kar yang dkon mchog gsum dang / mchod rten chen po brgyad la sogs pa dge ba'i rgyun du byas nas nyal na rmi lam na yang dge ba spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran dang ldan zhing dge rgyud dang // zhes bya ba ni de ltar dran pa dang ldan par byas nas nyal kar yang dkon mchog gsum dang / mchod rten chen po brgyad la sogs pa dge ba'i rgyun du byas nas nyal na rmi lam na yang dge ba spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should lie down with mindfulness and a virtuous mental orientation means that, having practiced with mindfulness in this way, one should lie down, having made a virtuous mental orientation toward the Three Jewels, the eight great stupas, and so forth. Because one practices virtue even in dreams, if one lies down in this way,

original: de bzhin myur du sad nas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin myur du sad nas ni //
translated: one will quickly awaken in the same way.

original: de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas /
translated: Having done this,

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one should practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: ji skad zhus pa dang / gong @45a * //
analyzed: ji skad zhus pa dang / gong @45a * //
translated: means as requested and as taught above.

original: du bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: du bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag 'dor ci dgos she na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag 'dor ci dgos she na /
translated: How does one quickly exhaust the afflictions? means why is it necessary to abandon them?

original: nyon mongs pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise from the afflictions.

original: las las kyang tshe 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las las kyang tshe 'byung ngo //
translated: Life arises from karma.

original: tshe las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the afflictions arise from life.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yang tshul de lta bu lags te ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yang tshul de lta bu lags te ;
translated: Dependent origination is also like that.

original: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa'i dug zad par bya ba ched che'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa'i dug zad par bya ba ched che'o //
translated: Therefore, it is very important to exhaust the poison of the afflictions.

original: byang chub dam pa thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob 'gyur ba //
translated: One will attain supreme enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dag byang chub yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dag byang chub yin mod kyi /
translated: The śrāvakas do have enlightenment,

original: de dag dam pa ma yin pas de dag la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dam pa ma yin pas de dag la ni mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not supreme, so it is not called that.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Supreme enlightenment is called supreme because it is the full enlightenment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub gong mar bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub gong mar bsgrubs so //
translated: In that, one accomplishes the enlightenment above.

original: ma nus na zhar la 'grub pas bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ma nus na zhar la 'grub pas bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba la /
translated: If one is unable, one accomplishes it incidentally, and so one attains unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //
translated: One should be endowed with such diligence.

original: zhes bya ba ni smon lam gdab pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smon lam gdab pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: One should be endowed with the aspiration prayer.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi dge tshul gyi bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi dge tshul gyi bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The duties of the novice of the Sarvāstivādins are complete.
